answerText: electronegativity[10] Hard acids and bases tend to have higher energies for these two orbitals. One of these two orbitals contains the most reactive electrons of an atom, while the other is completely empty

question: Question: Answer some questions about hard-soft acid-base theory, for 10 points each.  [10] HSAB theory helps explain the stability of covalently bonded compounds, which is determined by the difference in this value between the two atoms. This quantity is typically measured on the Pauling scale.
